intro: Stephania discolor var. hernandiifolia, commonly known as the Himalayan arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces fleshy, edible tubers that are used in traditional cuisines. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and economically valuable in certain regions.
